Description: Shallow symmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: with wide, convex cutting edge, concave butt and short, very slightly hooked lugs. It has seven binding-holes, which are evenly spaced and are positioned in a curved line running parallel to the butt. The blade is thin and the cutting edge was worked to a fairly sharp edge. There are no obvious signs of wear. It is lightly corroded. The curved line of the haft is preserved.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (68)
